paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: varied, including individuals from Portugal and the United States
patients.phenotype: hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (hATTR) with peripheral neuropathy and cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with peripheral neuropathy at age 40 and was diagnosed with hATTR at age 42.
This individual was diagnosed with hATTR at age 48 after presenting with symptoms of cardiomyopathy.
At age 30, this individual is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is associated with misfolding of the TTR protein, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met variant segregates with disease in families with a history of hATTR.
variants.population_frequency: 1:538 in Portugal; 1:100,000 to 1:1,000,000 in the United States
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met variant is the most common pathogenic variant associated with hATTR.
key_quotes: Over 120 pathogenic TTR mutations are now described, with the most common worldwide variant (Val30Met).
hATTR has early and late onset forms, with early onset hATTR having more autonomic involvement.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: This patient was diagnosed with hATTR at age 58 after presenting with heart failure symptoms.
At age 50, this individual is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The Val142Ile variant is associated with cardiac amyloidosis, particularly in African American populations.

variants.segregation_data: The Val142Ile variant segregates with disease in families with a history of cardiac amyloidosis.
variants.population_frequency: 3% of African Americans in the US carry the mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The Val142Ile variant is primarily associated with cardiac manifestations of hATTR.
key_quotes: The Val142Ile mutation is the most prevalent form in the US and is primarily cardiac.
3% of African Americans in the US carrying the mutation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with amyloidosis

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted accurately from the provided text.
